intro: Pimpinella multiradiata, commonly known as the multiradiate cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a taproot system and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal uses.
